questions.questionText: What is fatigue?
answers: Feeling relaxed and refreshed
Feeling tired and lacking energy
Feeling alert and attentive
questions.hint: Fatigue is a state of feeling tired and lacking energy that can affect your ability to drive safely.

questions.questionText: What is the recommended length of a break to prevent driver fatigue?
answers: 15 minutes every 2 hours
30 minutes every 4 hours
1 hour every 6 hours
questions.hint: Experts recommend taking a break of at least 15 minutes every two hours of driving to prevent driver fatigue.

questions.questionText: What is the impact of driving at night on alertness?
answers: Driving at night has no impact on alertness.
Driving at night can cause driver fatigue.
Driving at night can increase alertness.
questions.hint: Driving at night can disrupt your circadian rhythm, making you feel more tired and increasing the risk of driver fatigue.

questions.questionText: What is the impact of low blood sugar on alertness?
answers: Low blood sugar can increase alertness.
Low blood sugar can cause driver fatigue.
Low blood sugar has no impact on alertness.
questions.hint: Low blood sugar can cause fatigue and drowsiness, which can impact your alertness while driving.

questions.questionText: What is the role of exercise in reducing driver fatigue?
answers: Exercise has no impact on driver fatigue.
Exercise can increase driver fatigue.
Exercise can reduce driver fatigue.
questions.hint: Exercise can help boost energy levels, reduce stress, and promote better sleep, all of which can help reduce driver fatigue.

questions.questionText: What is the impact of loud music on driver alertness?
answers: Loud music can increase driver alertness.
Loud music can cause driver fatigue.
Loud music has no impact on driver alertness.
questions.hint: Loud music can be distracting and increase mental fatigue, leading to driver fatigue.

questions.questionText: What is the recommended amount of sleep per night to maintain alertness?
answers: 4-5 hours
6-7 hours
8-9 hours
questions.hint: Most adults need 7-9 hours of sleep per night to feel alert and rested.

questions.questionText: What is the impact of dehydration on driver alertness?
answers: Dehydration can increase driver alertness.
Dehydration can cause driver fatigue.
Dehydration has no impact on driver alertness.
questions.hint: Dehydration can cause fatigue and drowsiness, which can impact your alertness while driving.

questions.questionText: What is the impact of driving on an empty stomach on alertness?
answers: Driving on an empty stomach can increase alertness.
Driving on an empty stomach can cause driver fatigue.
Driving on an empty stomach has no impact on alertness.
questions.hint: Driving on an empty stomach can cause low blood sugar and fatigue, which can impact your alertness while driving.

questions.questionText: What is the impact of medication on driver alertness?
answers: Medication has no impact on driver alertness.
Medication can increase driver alertness.
Medication can cause driver fatigue.
questions.hint: Some medications can cause drowsiness and fatigue, which can impact your alertness while driving.

questions.questionText: What can cause you to become drowsy while driving?
answers: Long periods of driving without a break
Driving during the day
Driving on a busy road
questions.hint: Driving for long periods without taking a break can cause you to become drowsy and affect your ability to drive safely.

questions.questionText: What should you do if you feel drowsy while driving?
answers: Stop driving as soon as possible and take a nap
Turn up the radio to stay awake
Drink coffee to stay awake
questions.hint: If you feel drowsy while driving, you should stop driving as soon as possible and take a nap, or do something to help you stay alert, such as drinking coffee or taking a short walk.

questions.questionText: What is road rage?
answers: A feeling of happiness while driving
A feeling of anger and frustration while driving
A feeling of sadness and loneliness while driving
questions.hint: Road rage is a feeling of anger and frustration that can arise while driving, often due to other drivers' actions or traffic conditions.

questions.questionText: What should you do if you experience road rage?
answers: Ignore the other driver and keep driving safely
Confront the other driver and try to resolve the situation
Speed up and try to get away from the other driver
questions.hint: If you experience road rage, you should ignore the other driver and focus on driving safely. Avoid confrontations and try to stay calm.

questions.questionText: How can you avoid road rage?
answers: Listen to calming music while driving
Plan your route and avoid busy roads
Stay calm and patient while driving
questions.hint: You can avoid road rage by staying calm and patient while driving, planning your route to avoid busy roads, and listening to calming music or other relaxation techniques.

questions.questionText: What should you do if your vehicle starts to skid?
answers: Brake hard and steer in the opposite direction
Accelerate hard and steer in the opposite direction
Steer in the direction of the skid and gently apply the brakes
questions.hint: If your vehicle starts to skid, you should steer in the direction of the skid and gently apply the brakes. Do not brake hard or accelerate.

questions.questionText: What is the minimum legal tire tread depth?
answers: 1.0mm
1.6mm
2.0mm
questions.hint: The minimum legal tire tread depth is 1.6mm. Tires with less than this amount of tread may not provide adequate grip and can be dangerous.

questions.questionText: When should you check the oil level in your vehicle?
answers: Every year
Every 5,000 miles
Every month
questions.hint: You should check the oil level in your vehicle every month or before long journeys. Low oil levels can cause damage to your engine.

questions.questionText: What is the two-second rule?
answers: A method of measuring your speed
A method of checking your tire pressure
A method of maintaining a safe following distance
questions.hint: The two-second rule is a method of maintaining a safe following distance behind the vehicle in front of you. You should keep a distance of at least two seconds between your vehicle and the vehicle in front of you.

questions.questionText: What is the recommended stopping distance in wet or icy conditions?
answers: Two times the normal stopping distance
Three times the normal stopping distance
Four times the normal stopping distance
questions.hint: In wet or icy conditions, you should increase your stopping distance to at least four times the normal distance. This will give you more time to react and stop your vehicle safely.

questions.questionText: What is the legal minimum depth for tire tread?
answers: 1.0mm
1.6mm
2.0mm
questions.hint: The legal minimum depth for tire tread is 1.6mm. Tires with less than this amount of tread may not provide adequate grip and can be dangerous.

questions.questionText: What is a hazard?
answers: Something that is safe and not a risk to drivers
Something that is a risk to drivers
Something that is not related to driving
questions.hint: A hazard is something that is a risk to drivers and can cause an accident or harm.

questions.questionText: What should you do if you see a hazard ahead?
answers: Speed up to get past the hazard quickly
Slow down and be prepared to stop if necessary
Ignore the hazard and keep driving
questions.hint: If you see a hazard ahead, you should slow down and be prepared to stop if necessary. Ignoring the hazard can be dangerous.

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of a hazard warning signal?
answers: To indicate that you are changing lanes
To indicate that you are stopping or slowing down
To indicate that you are accelerating
questions.hint: The hazard warning signal is used to indicate that you are stopping or slowing down due to a hazard or an emergency situation.

questions.questionText: What is the speed limit in a built-up area?
answers: 20 mph
30 mph
40 mph
questions.hint: The speed limit in a built-up area is 30 mph, unless otherwise indicated by signs or road markings.

questions.questionText: What should you do when approaching a pedestrian crossing?
answers: Speed up to get past the crossing quickly
Slow down and be prepared to stop if necessary
Ignore the crossing and keep driving
questions.hint: When approaching a pedestrian crossing, you should slow down and be prepared to stop if necessary. Ignoring the crossing can be dangerous to pedestrians.

questions.questionText: What is a vulnerable road user?
answers: A pedestrian
A cyclist
A motorcyclist
All of the above
questions.hint: A vulnerable road user is someone who is more likely to be injured or killed in a traffic accident, such as pedestrians, cyclists, and motorcyclists.

questions.questionText: What is the maximum speed limit for a vehicle towing a trailer on a motorway?
answers: 40 mph
50 mph
60 mph
questions.hint: The maximum speed limit for a vehicle towing a trailer on a motorway is 60 mph. However, you should always drive at a speed that is safe and appropriate for the road and weather conditions.

questions.questionText: What should you do when overtaking a cyclist?
answers: Sound your horn to alert them
Leave plenty of room and give them plenty of space
Drive as close as possible to them
questions.hint: When overtaking a cyclist, you should leave plenty of room and give them plenty of space. This will help to prevent accidents and ensure the safety of the cyclist.

questions.questionText: What is the maximum weight allowed for a vehicle without a commercial license?
questions.hint: The maximum weight allowed for a vehicle without a commercial license is 3,500 kg. Vehicles that weigh more than this require a commercial license to operate.

questions.questionText: What should you do when driving in heavy rain or snow?
answers: Use your high beam headlights
Reduce your speed and increase your following distance
Drive as fast as you normally would
questions.hint: When driving in heavy rain or snow, you should reduce your speed and increase your following distance. This will give you more time to react to hazards and help you maintain control of your vehicle.

questions.questionText: What is aquaplaning?
answers: When your vehicle slides on ice
When your brakes fail
When your tires lose contact with the road due to water
questions.hint: Aquaplaning is when your tires lose contact with the road due to water, causing you to lose control of your vehicle. This can happen when driving too fast on wet roads, and can be dangerous.

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of anti-lock brakes?
answers: To prevent skidding while braking
To increase the vehicle's top speed
To improve fuel efficiency
questions.hint: Anti-lock brakes are designed to prevent skidding while braking. They work by automatically pumping the brakes to prevent the wheels from locking up.

questions.questionText: What is the minimum speed limit on a motorway?
answers: 30 mph
40 mph
50 mph
There is no minimum speed limit
questions.hint: There is no minimum speed limit on a motorway, but you should always drive at a safe and appropriate speed for the road and traffic conditions.

questions.questionText: What should you do if you break down on a motorway?
answers: Stay in your vehicle and wait for help
Exit your vehicle and wait on the side of the road
Flag down passing motorists for help
questions.hint: If you break down on a motorway, you should stay in your vehicle and wait for help to arrive. Do not attempt to exit your vehicle or flag down passing motorists, as this can be dangerous.

questions.questionText: What is the national speed limit on a motorway?
answers: 50 mph
60 mph
70 mph
questions.hint: The national speed limit on a motorway is 70 mph, unless otherwise indicated by signs or road markings.

questions.questionText: What is the legal alcohol limit for drivers in England, Wales, and Northern Ireland?
answers: 0.2g/l of blood
0.5g/l of blood
0.8g/l of blood
questions.hint: The legal alcohol limit for drivers in England, Wales, and Northern Ireland is 0.5g/l of blood. This is equivalent to approximately one small glass of wine or one pint of beer.

questions.questionText: What is the legal alcohol limit for drivers in Scotland?
answers: 0.2g/l of blood
0.5g/l of blood
0.8g/l of blood
questions.hint: The legal alcohol limit for drivers in Scotland is 0.2g/l of blood. This is lower than the limit in England, Wales, and Northern Ireland.

questions.questionText: What should you do if you see a red triangle warning sign on the road?
answers: Slow down and be prepared to stop if necessary
Ignore the sign and keep driving
Speed up to get past the sign quickly
questions.hint: If you see a red triangle warning sign on the road, you should slow down and be prepared to stop if necessary. The sign indicates a hazard or danger ahead.

questions.questionText: What does a red and white circular sign with a line through it mean?
answers: No entry
Stop
No overtaking
questions.hint: A red and white circular sign with a line through it indicates that overtaking is not allowed on the road where the sign is displayed.

questions.questionText: What does a blue circular sign with a white arrow pointing downwards mean?
answers: One-way street
No entry
No parking
questions.hint: A blue circular sign with a white arrow pointing downwards indicates that the road is a one-way street and traffic must travel in the direction of the arrow.

questions.questionText: What does a brown sign with a white tent and campfire symbol indicate?
answers: A campsite or caravan site
A tourist attraction
A scenic route
questions.hint: A brown sign with a white tent and campfire symbol indicates the location of a campsite or caravan site.

questions.questionText: What document must you have to legally drive a vehicle?
answers: A driving license
A passport
A birth certificate
questions.hint: To legally drive a vehicle, you must have a driving license that is valid for the type of vehicle you are driving.

questions.questionText: What documents must you have with you when driving a vehicle?
answers: Insurance certificate, driving license, and MOT certificate
Passport, driving license, and insurance certificate
Birth certificate, driving license, and insurance certificate
questions.hint: When driving a vehicle, you must have your driving license, insurance certificate, and MOT certificate (if applicable) with you.

questions.questionText: What is the penalty for driving without insurance?
answers: A fine and points on your driving license
A warning from the police
A ban from driving
questions.hint: Driving without insurance is illegal and can result in a fine and points on your driving license. In some cases, your vehicle may also be seized.

questions.questionText: What should you do if you are involved in a minor traffic accident?
answers: Move your vehicle off the road and call the police
Exchange details with the other driver and leave the scene
Stop your vehicle and turn off the engine
questions.hint: If you are involved in a minor traffic accident, you should exchange details with the other driver and leave the scene as soon as it is safe to do so.

questions.questionText: What should you do if you come across an accident while driving?
answers: Stop and offer assistance
Drive past as quickly as possible
Call the police and report the accident
questions.hint: If you come across an accident while driving, you should stop and offer assistance if it is safe to do so. If necessary, call the emergency services for further assistance.

questions.questionText: What should you do if your vehicle breaks down on a busy road?
answers: Stay in your vehicle and wait for help
Exit your vehicle and stand on the side of the road
Flag down passing motorists for help
questions.hint: If your vehicle breaks down on a busy road, you should stay in your vehicle and wait for help to arrive. Do not attempt to exit your vehicle or flag down passing motorists, as this can be dangerous.

questions.questionText: What is the maximum weight a vehicle can carry?
questions.hint: The maximum weight a vehicle can carry is 3,500 kg. This includes the weight of the vehicle, passengers, and any goods or cargo being transported.

questions.questionText: What is the correct way to load a vehicle?
answers: Load heavier items on top of lighter items
Load lighter items on top of heavier items
Load items randomly to save time
questions.hint: When loading a vehicle, you should load lighter items on top of heavier items. This will help to ensure that the weight is evenly distributed and that the vehicle remains stable while driving.

questions.questionText: What is the penalty for overloading a vehicle?
answers: A fine and points on your driving license
A warning from the police
A ban from driving
questions.hint: Overloading a vehicle is illegal and can result in a fine and points on your driving license. In some cases, your vehicle may also be impounded.
